Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Crayola announced the removal of the "dandelion" color from their basic box of 24 crayons due to a complaint from the White House.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the reason for the removal of the "dandelion" color by stating that it was due to children using it to create unflattering portraits of President Trump.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by misrepresenting the actual reason for the removal of the "dandelion" color.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the removal of the "dandelion" color was influenced by a complaint from the White House.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the removal of the "dandelion" color.
